pullRequest.body:
For error messages that span multiple lines, now we can use the new "string gap" escape sequence (a `\` at the end of the line, which causes all the whitespace at the beginning of the next line ignored), rather than using append operations or hacks involving `{` and `}` for `s!` and `m!` strings.

Style-wise, we suggest for long messages that the body of the message start on the next line if possible, by starting the message with a string gap sequence. This eliminates needing to decide whether to indent continuing lines at the `"` or at the next column. For example:
```lean
    logError m!"\
      Tactic 'more_magic' cannot \
      apply expression{indentD e}\n\
      due to some reason or another."
```
Note that to get whitespace to appear between one line and the next, you include it before the `\`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

the spaces look a bit inconsistent here (also in the original), is this deliberate?
I don't know what's going on with the additional spaces in the original. I got as far as figuring out that it's `[2x2 matrix, vector]` and tried lining it up in the source code.
@digama0 Should we try to fix the whitespace for this repr instance before merging? or could we leave it as-is?
I think unless more information is forthcoming it should be fine to just remove the spaces on the first line.
Done

@digama0 Do want to make any more changes, or are you happy with sending this PR onto the queue?

(Just pinging you because I'm not sure what your approval means precisely, whether that means you're waiting for another maintainer's opinion, whether it means you've delegated it to me, or whether it would be ok if I sent this to the maintainer merge queue myself.)

```suggestion
        throwError "There already exist stored eqns for '{declName}' registering new equations\n\
          will not have the desired effect."
```

I slipped in this message change. Having a newline there at that position didn't make sense to me.

@eric-wieser Do you want this newline?
@eric-wieser ping
No, I agree this newline should be removed

Though it looks like there is a mistake in this message:
```suggestion
        throwError "There already exist stored eqns for '{declName}'; registering new equations \
          will not have the desired effect."
```

```suggestion
        The definition {nm} is not a constructor application. Please use `@[simps!]` instead.\n\
        \n\
        Explanation: `@[simps]` uses the definition to find what the simp lemmas should \
```

```suggestion
    throwError "Invalid simp lemma {simpLemma}. \
      Structure {str} does not have projection {neededProj}.\n\
      The known projections are:\
        {indentD projs}\n\
      You can also see this information by running\n  \
        `initialize_simps_projections? {str}`.\n\
      Note: these projection names might be customly defined for `simps`, \
      and could differ from the projection names of the structure."
```

There needs to be a `toMessageData` in there to use `indentD`, so here's another suggestion to be able to add it to the batch. I also am not sure about stowing away indentation on the previous line, so here's an alternative.

```suggestion
    throwError "Invalid simp lemma {simpLemma}. \
      Structure {str} does not have projection {neededProj}.\n\
      The known projections are:\
      {indentD <| toMessageData projs}\n\
      You can also see this information by running\
      \n  `initialize_simps_projections? {str}`.\n\
      Note: these projection names might be customly defined for `simps`, \
      and could differ from the projection names of the structure."
```
suggestion doesn't work, but consider hanging the `m!"\` here instead of `<|` on the previous line

I was thinking of hanging `m!"\`, but I thought that it would make it less clear that there's the `++ if` logic later. I think I'd rather leave this as a direct translation and then let Floris deal with this the next time he touches this part of ToAdditive.
